Leonardo da Vinci: I would bring Leonardo da Vinci back to life because of his incredible multidisciplinary talents. He was an artist, scientist, inventor, musician, and writer. I am fascinated by his ability to excel in so many different fields and I would love to see how he would approach modern problems and challenges.

Cleopatra: I would bring Cleopatra back to life because of her intelligence, charisma, and political acumen. She was one of the most powerful women in history and I would love to learn from her leadership skills and strategies.

Martin Luther King Jr.: I would bring Martin Luther King Jr. back to life because of his inspiring leadership and advocacy for civil rights. I would love to hear his thoughts on current social and political issues and see how he would continue to fight for justice and equality.

Albert Einstein: I would bring Albert Einstein back to life because of his groundbreaking contributions to science and physics. I would love to hear his thoughts on current scientific theories and see how he would continue to push the boundaries of knowledge and understanding.

Jane Austen: I would bring Jane Austen back to life because of her wit, social commentary, and insightful observations about human nature. I would love to hear her thoughts on modern society and see how she would navigate the complexities of modern life.
